verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Also, thou son of man, thus saith the Lord GOD unto the land of Israel; An end, the end is come upon the four corners of the land.
verses.ct: "Son of man, this is what the Lord GOD says to the land of Israel: The end! The end has arrived for every corner of the land.

verses.kjv: Now is the end come upon thee, and I will send mine anger upon thee, and will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense upon thee all thine abominations.
verses.ct: The end is now upon you. I will unleash my anger against you and judge you by how you have lived. I will make you pay for all your disgusting practices.

verses.kjv: And mine eye shall not spare thee, neither will I have pity: but I will recompense thy ways upon thee, and thine abominations shall be in the midst of thee: and ye shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: I will show you no compassion and no mercy. I will hold you accountable for your behavior, and your disgusting practices will be exposed among you. Then you will know that I am the LORD."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; An evil, an only evil, behold, is come.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: Disaster! An unprecedented disaster — look, it is coming!

verses.kjv: An end is come, the end is come: it watcheth for thee; behold, it is come.
verses.ct: The end has arrived! The end has arrived! It has been waiting for you — look, it is here!

verses.kjv: The morning is come unto thee, O thou that dwellest in the land: the time is come, the day of trouble is near, and not the sounding again of the mountains.
verses.ct: Your doom has come, you who live in the land. The time has arrived. The day of chaos is near — not joyful shouts echoing on the mountains.

verses.kjv: Now will I shortly pour out my fury upon thee, and accomplish mine anger upon thee: and I will judge thee according to thy ways, and will recompense thee for all thine abominations.
verses.ct: Very soon I will pour out my rage on you and fully unleash my anger against you. I will judge you by how you have lived and make you pay for all your disgusting practices.

verses.kjv: And mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity: I will recompense thee according to thy ways and thine abominations that are in the midst of thee; and ye shall know that I am the LORD that smiteth.
verses.ct: I will show no compassion and no mercy. I will hold you accountable for your behavior and for the disgusting practices among you. Then you will know that I am the LORD who strikes.

verses.kjv: Behold the day, behold, it is come: the morning is gone forth; the rod hath blossomed, pride hath budded.
verses.ct: Look at the day! Look, it has arrived! Your doom has come. The rod has blossomed, and arrogance has sprouted.

verses.kjv: Violence is risen up into a rod of wickedness: none of them shall remain, nor of their multitude, nor of any of theirs: neither shall there be wailing for them.
verses.ct: Violence has grown into a weapon of wickedness. None of them will survive — not their crowds, not their wealth. There will be no one left to mourn them.

verses.kjv: The time is come, the day draweth near: let not the buyer rejoice, nor the seller mourn: for wrath is upon all the multitude thereof.
verses.ct: The time has arrived; the day is near. The buyer should not celebrate, and the seller should not grieve, because fury is coming against the entire population.

verses.kjv: For the seller shall not return to that which is sold, although they were yet alive: for the vision is touching the whole multitude thereof, which shall not return; neither shall any strengthen himself in the iniquity of his life.
verses.ct: The seller will never return to reclaim what was sold, even if they are still alive. The vision concerning the entire population will not be reversed. No one will preserve their life through their sin.

verses.kjv: They have blown the trumpet, even to make all ready; but none goeth to the battle: for my wrath is upon all the multitude thereof.
verses.ct: They have sounded the trumpet and prepared everything, but no one goes out to fight, because my fury is directed at the entire population.

verses.kjv: The sword is without, and the pestilence and the famine within: he that is in the field shall die with the sword; and he that is in the city, famine and pestilence shall devour him.
verses.ct: Outside the city there is war; inside there is disease and starvation. Those in the open countryside will die by the sword, and those in the city will be consumed by famine and plague.

verses.kjv: But they that escape of them shall escape, and shall be on the mountains like doves of the valleys, all of them mourning, every one for his iniquity.
verses.ct: Any survivors who escape will flee to the mountains, moaning like doves in the valleys — every one of them grieving over their own sin.

verses.kjv: All hands shall be feeble, and all knees shall be weak as water.
verses.ct: Every hand will go limp, and every knee will turn to water.

verses.kjv: They shall also gird themselves with sackcloth, and horror shall cover them; and shame shall be upon all faces, and baldness upon all their heads.
verses.ct: They will dress in rough cloth, and terror will overwhelm them. Shame will cover every face, and every head will be shaved in grief.

verses.kjv: They shall cast their silver in the streets, and their gold shall be removed: their silver and their gold shall not be able to deliver them in the day of the wrath of the LORD: they shall not satisfy their souls, neither fill their bowels: because it is the stumblingblock of their iniquity.
verses.ct: They will throw their silver into the streets, and their gold will be treated like garbage. Their silver and gold will be powerless to rescue them on the day of the LORD's fury. It will not fill their stomachs or satisfy their souls, because it was the very thing that led them into sin.

verses.kjv: As for the beauty of his ornament, he set it in majesty: but they made the images of their abominations and of their detestable things therein: therefore have I set it far from them.
verses.ct: They took their beautiful jewelry and used it to craft their disgusting and detestable idols. That is why I have turned it into something repulsive to them.

verses.kjv: And I will give it into the hands of the strangers for a prey, and to the wicked of the earth for a spoil; and they shall pollute it.
verses.ct: I will hand it over to foreigners as plunder and to the most wicked people on earth as loot, and they will defile it.

verses.kjv: My face will I turn also from them, and they shall pollute my secret place: for the robbers shall enter into it, and defile it.
verses.ct: I will withdraw my favor from my people, and invaders will desecrate my treasured place. Violent intruders will enter it and defile it.

verses.kjv: Make a chain: for the land is full of bloody crimes, and the city is full of violence.
verses.ct: "Forge chains! For the land is drenched in bloodshed, and the city is filled with violence.

verses.kjv: Wherefore I will bring the worst of the heathen, and they shall possess their houses: I will also make the pomp of the strong to cease; and their holy places shall be defiled.
verses.ct: That is why I will bring the most ruthless nations, and they will seize their homes. I will put an end to the pride of the powerful, and their sacred places will be desecrated.

verses.kjv: Destruction cometh; and they shall seek peace, and there shall be none.
verses.ct: Anguish is coming. They will search for peace, but there will be none.

verses.kjv: Mischief shall come upon mischief, and rumour shall be upon rumour; then shall they seek a vision of the prophet; but the law shall perish from the priest, and counsel from the ancients.
verses.ct: One catastrophe will follow another, and one rumor will chase the next. They will beg for a vision from a prophet, but instruction will vanish from the priests, and wisdom will disappear from the elders.

verses.kjv: The king shall mourn, and the prince shall be clothed with desolation, and the hands of the people of the land shall be troubled: I will do unto them after their way, and according to their deserts will I judge them; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: The king will be in mourning, the prince will be wrapped in despair, and the hands of the common people will tremble. I will treat them exactly as they have acted, and I will judge them as they deserve. Then they will know that I am the LORD."
